sn5.6:1.2: Then the nun Cālā robed up in the morning …
sn5.6:1.3: and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn5.6:1.4: Then Māra the Wicked went up to Cālā and said to her,
sn5.6:2.2: When you’re born, you get to enjoy sensual pleasures.
sn5.6:2.3: Who put this idea in your head:
sn5.6:3.1: “Death comes to those who are born,
sn5.6:3.2: when you’re born you undergo sufferings—
sn5.6:3.4: that’s why you shouldn’t approve of rebirth.
sn5.6:4.1: The Buddha taught me the Dhamma
sn5.6:4.4: he settled me in the truth.
sn5.6:5.1: There are beings in the realm of luminous form,
sn5.6:5.2: and others established in the formless.
sn5.6:6.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The nun Cālā knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
